"Gordon Freeman in the flesh or rather, in the hazard suit"

Half Life. What is there to say about such an influential game? This game - although not as important as Doom was for FPS games (in my opinion) - changed how we see and play the games of today.

As we all know by now, thanks to the opening sequence alone games today have a story to tell you with the environment around them and with cut scenes... But I don‚Äôt believe anything has been done as well as Half Life and its opening sequence. These days we have unskippable cut scenes giving you a complete dumb of information, at times being too much to handle for someone who just started the game but Half Life lets you discover the story for yourself, the opening shows you a LOT of what‚Äôs happening in Black Mesa but without completely overloading is with everything going on - it is really a teaser for what‚Äôs to come. Again, nothing like this (as far as I remember) has been done after Half Life - sure they changed the format of games, but as I said, they dump info instead of letting you the player figure it all out.

The game is a little rough around the edges, this is a game of its time still, although the story and the environment is fun to play around with the AI can be a bit messy. Although the AI can be smart and look for alternative methods to take you down, they‚Äôre still very predictable and at times can break - for example, the G-Man later on in the game glitched out for me and wouldn‚Äôt move even when I was right next to him, it did break my immersion but these moments are far and few in-between.

The character interaction must be a highlight these days, again I may be remembering wrong but there aren‚Äôt many or any games where you can interact with almost every character. Even after the shit hits the fan, the leftover scientists and guards react to the current situation and talk to each other - a limited number of dialogue can be heard but again, that‚Äôs a lot more than what we get for today‚Äôs games.

And the ending, oh my god the ending, although not as impressive to look at now, the introduction and explanation of why there was a blue-suited man following you around Black Mesa is amazing and a great way to end this weird adventure.

This games graphics are dated, sure, but its still really fun to play!

Edit:
While I did enjoy the game, near the end I just wanted to finish the game so I can play Half Life 2, the Xen levels are not that great. And there is this weird bug where I close the game on steam or just shutting the window, it says I'm still playing it, thus the 50+ hours of playtime. It's a good game, get when you feel like it.

I remember playing Half Life back in the day, so it was nice revisiting the game. I like that the community offers alternatives to play it as close to the original as possible as well as with the updates the game now offers.

All in all I recommend it highly.
